title: Support Container
reference-overview: The Support Container is a secondary containing element that can be used to "support" other elements on the screen.
reference-usage: It should be used lower on the page in a more subserviant/supporting mode. It can list out for example; Quick Links, Reports, etc. and provide a link to more details.
reference-details:
Components

  • The Support Container is comprised of the following four components:
    • Border
    • Header
    • Horizontal Line
    • Content
  • The border color (#6b90b8) should always be a solid, 1 pixel line.
  • The header size for Support Containers is h4.
  • The Horizontal Line directly under the Support Container's color should always be #C3D2E5.
  • The background color should always be #E9EEF5.
  • It sometimes can also include a link (on header right side) that may link to more information or a full list.
  • It can also include icons within the list that associate with the links/content.

Sizing and Layout

  • The content margins inside all Mercer Feature Containers will have 15 pixels of padding all around.
  • The padding inside a Support Container from the line under the header to the beginning of the actual content is also 15 pixels.
  • Support Container height and width are variable based on inside content height and width.

Grids

  • Feature Containers work within the Mercer Evolution Grid System.
  • Feature Containers can contain grids inside of them to display and section off data within the container.
reference-mobile:
• In the mobile version of this container the width will shrink to span the width of the parent container.
  • Font size increases for mobile.
